schema_fields.title: Gateway Identifier
schema_fields.description: Associated identifier (number) that is the BigInt key in our SQL database for the dataset version associated with this metadata

schema_fields.title: Gateway Persistent Identifier
schema_fields.description: A unique persistent identifier for the metadata version. This is a 128-bit unique identifiers, as 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens

schema_fields.title: Metadata Issued Datetime',
schema_fields.description: Datetime stamp of when this metadata version was initially issued

schema_fields.title: Last Modified Datetime
schema_fields.description: Datetime stamp of when this metadata was last modified

schema_fields.title: revision version
schema_fields.description: Version number used for previous version of this dataset

schema_fields.title: revision url
schema_fields.description: Some url with a reference to the record of a previous version of this dataset

schema_fields.title: Dataset Version
schema_fields.description: Dataset metadata version

schema_fields.title: Title
schema_fields.description: The main title of the dataset
examples: Publications that mention HDR-UK (or any variant thereof) in Acknowledgements or Author Affiliations

schema_fields.title: Short Title
schema_fields.description: A shorter descriptive title of the dataset

schema_fields.title: DOI Name
schema_fields.description: DOI associated to this dataset

schema_fields.title: Abstract
schema_fields.description: Longer abstract detailing the dataset.
examples: COVID-19 Key Worker Testing Results data is required by NHS Digital to support COVID-19 requests for linkage, analysis and dissemination to other organisations who require the data in a timely manner.

schema_fields.title: Keywords
schema_fields.description: Comma separated key words associated to this dataset.

schema_fields.title: Controlled Keywords
schema_fields.description: Keywords that have been filtered and limited

schema_fields.title: Contact Point
schema_fields.description: email of a person who can be the main contact point of this dataset

schema_fields.title: Dataset type
schema_fields.description: What type of dataset is this?

schema_fields.title: Description
schema_fields.description: Longer description of the dataset in detail
examples:
Publications that mention HDR-UK (or any variant thereof) in Acknowledgements or Author Affiliations

This will include:
- Papers
- COVID-19 Papers
- COVID-19 Preprint

schema_fields.title: Organisation Name
schema_fields.description: Name of the organisation

schema_fields.title: Organisation Gateway Identifier
schema_fields.description: Identifier on the gateway

schema_fields.title: Research Organization Registry Identifier
schema_fields.description: The Research Organization Registry (ROR) for the organisation, if applicable

schema_fields.title: Population size
schema_fields.description: Summary population size of the cohort

schema_fields.title: Dataset Sub-type
schema_fields.description: Placeholder for dataset sub-type

schema_fields.title: Dataset pipeline status
schema_fields.description: Indicate whether this dataset is currently available for Researchers to request access.

schema_fields.title: Geographic Coverage
schema_fields.description: The geographical area covered by the dataset. It is recommended that links are to entries in a well-maintained gazetteer such as https://www.geonames.org/ or https://what3words.com/daring.lion.race.

schema_fields.title: Pathway
schema_fields.description: Please indicate if the dataset is representative of the patient pathway and any limitations the dataset may have with respect to pathway coverage. This could include if the dataset is from a single speciality or area, a single tier of care, linked across two tiers (e.g. primary and secondary care), or an integrated care record covering the whole patient pathway.

schema_fields.title: Followup
schema_fields.description: If known, what is the typical time span that a patient appears in the dataset (follow up period)

schema_fields.title: Age Range
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the age range in whole years of participants in the dataset. Please provide range in the following format '[min age] – [max age]' where both the minimum and maximum are whole numbers (integers).

schema_fields.title: Dataset coverage/completeness/quality
schema_fields.description: The URL where a Researcher can learn more about the completeness of the dataset.

schema_fields.title: Purpose
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the purpose(s) that the dataset was collected.

schema_fields.title: Source
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the source of the data extraction

schema_fields.title: Collection Situation Setting
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the setting(s) where data was collected. Multiple settings may be provided

schema_fields.title: Image contrast
schema_fields.description: Indicate whether usage of imaging contrast is captured within the dataset.

schema_fields.title: Start Date
schema_fields.description: The start of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for. If there are multiple cohorts in the dataset with varying start dates, please provide the earliest date and use the description or the media attribute to provide more information.

schema_fields.title: End Date
schema_fields.description: The end of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for. If the dataset is “Continuous” and has no known end date, please state continuous. If there are multiple cohorts in the dataset with varying end dates, please provide the latest date and use the description or the media attribute to provide more information.'

schema_fields.title: Time Lag
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the typical time-lag between an event and the data for that event appearing in the dataset

schema_fields.title: Periodicity
schema_fields.description: Please indicate the frequency of distribution release. If a dataset is distributed regularly please choose a distribution release periodicity from the constrained list and indicate the next release date. When the release date becomes historical, a new release date will be calculated based on the publishing periodicity. If a dataset has been published and will remain static please indicate that it is static and indicated when it was released. If a dataset is released on an irregular basis or “on-demand” please indicate that it is Irregular and leave release date as null. If a dataset can be published in real-time or near-real-time please indicate that it is continuous and leave release date as null. Notes: see https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/collection-description/frequency/

schema_fields.title: Release Date
schema_fields.description: Date of the latest release of the dataset. If this is a regular release i.e. quarterly, or this is a static dataset please complete this alongside Periodicity. If this is Irregular or Continuously released please leave this blank. Notes: Periodicity and release date will be used to determine when the next release is expected. E.g. if the release date is documented as 01/01/2020 and it is now 20/04/2020 and there is a quarterly release schedule, the latest release will be calculated as 01/04/2020.

schema_fields.title: Data Use Limitation
schema_fields.description: Please provide an indication of consent permissions for datasets and/or materials, and relates to the purposes for which datasets and/or material might be removed, stored or used. NOTE: we have extended the DUO to include a value for NO LINKAGE

schema_fields.title: Data Use Requirements
schema_fields.description: Please indicate fit here are any additional conditions set for use if any, multiple requirements may be provided. Please ensure that these restrictions are documented in access rights information.

schema_fields.title: Organisation Name
schema_fields.description: Name of the organisation

schema_fields.title: Organisation Gateway Identifier
schema_fields.description: Identifier on the gateway

schema_fields.title: Research Organization Registry Identifier
schema_fields.description: The Research Organization Registry (ROR) for the organisation, if applicable

schema_fields.title: Access Rights
schema_fields.description: Please provide details for the data access rights

schema_fields.title: Access Service
schema_fields.description: Please provide a brief description of the data access services that are available including: environment that is currently available to researchers;additional consultancy and services;any indication of costs associated. If no environment is currently available, please indicate the current plans and timelines when and how data will be made available to researchers Note: This value will be used as default access environment for all datasets submitted by the organisation. However, there will be the opportunity to overwrite this value for each dataset.

schema_fields.title: Organisation Access Request Cost
schema_fields.description: Please provide link(s) to a webpage detailing the commercial model for processing data access requests for the organisation (if available) Definition: Indication of commercial model or cost (in GBP) for processing each data access request by the data custodian.

schema_fields.title: Access Request Duration
schema_fields.description: Please provide an indication of the typical processing times based on the types of requests typically received.

schema_fields.title: Jurisdiction
schema_fields.description: Please use country code from ISO 3166-1 country codes and the associated ISO 3166-2 for regions, cities, states etc. for the country/state under whose laws the data subjects' data is collected, processed and stored.

schema_fields.title: Data Controller
schema_fields.description: Data Controller means a person/entity who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons/entities) determines the purposes for which and the way any Data Subject data, specifically personal data or are to be processed.

schema_fields.title: Data Processor
schema_fields.description: A Data Processor, in relation to any Data Subject data, specifically personal data, means any person/entity (other than an employee of the data controller) who processes the data on behalf of the data controller.

schema_fields.title: Access/governance requirements
schema_fields.description: Where access to data come from: TRE/SED, direct access, open acccess, varies based on project.

schema_fields.title: Access mode
schema_fields.description: Indication of the application type to enable research access.

schema_fields.title: Controlled Vocabulary
schema_fields.description: Code value of the ontology vocabulary encoding

schema_fields.title: Conforms To
schema_fields.description: What the vocabulary conforms to.

schema_fields.title: Language Code(s)
schema_fields.description: Language code(s) of the language of the dataset metadata and underlying data is made available.

schema_fields.title: Dataset Format
schema_fields.description: Format(s) the dataset can be made available in

schema_fields.title: Associated Media
schema_fields.description: Any media associated with the Gateway Organisation using a valid URI for the content. This is an opportunity to provide additional context that could be useful for researchers wanting to understand more about the dataset and its relevance to their research question

schema_fields.title: Is Reference in
schema_fields.description: The keystone paper associated with the dataset. Also include a list of known citations, if available and should be links to existing resources where the dataset has been used or referenced.',

schema_fields.title: Tools
schema_fields.description: URL of any analysis tools or models that have been created for this dataset and are available for further use

schema_fields.title: Derivations
schema_fields.description: Indicate if derived datasets or predefined extracts are available and the type of derivation available. Notes. Single or multiple dimensions can be provided as a derived extract alongside the dataset
examples: Data will be minimised as appropriate relative to the data access application

schema_fields.title: Is PartOf
schema_fields.description: If the dataset is part of a group or family
examples: UKCRC Tissue Directory and Coordination Centre

schema_fields.title: Is MemberOf
schema_fields.description: Dataset is a member of XXX(?)

schema_fields.title: Linked Datasets
schema_fields.description: Links to other datasets.
examples: Yes. To any SAIL dataset & reference data.,ALL

schema_fields.title: Investigations
schema_fields.description: Please provide the keystone paper associated with the dataset.

schema_fields.title: Synthetic Data Web Links
schema_fields.description: Links to locations of information and or raw downloads of synthetic data associated with this dataset

schema_fields.title: Publication about the dataset
schema_fields.description: DOIs for publications which describe the dataset.

schema_fields.title: Publication using the dataset
schema_fields.description: DOIs for publications which use the dataset for analysis.

schema_fields.title: Statistical Population
schema_fields.description: Please select one of the following statistical populations for you observation

schema_fields.title: Measured Value
schema_fields.description: Please provide the population size associated with the population type the dataset i.e. 1000 people in a study, or 87 images (MRI) of Knee Usage Note: Used with Statistical Population, which specifies the type of the population in the dataset.

schema_fields.title: Disambiguating Description
schema_fields.description: If SNOMED CT term does not provide sufficient detail, please provide a description that disambiguates the population type.

schema_fields.title: Observation Date
schema_fields.description: Please provide the date that the observation was made. Some datasets may be continuously updated and the number of records will change regularly, so the observation date provides users with the date that the analysis or query was run to generate the particular observation. Multiple observations can be made i.e. an observation of cumulative COVID positive cases by specimen on the 1/1/2021 could be 2M. On the 8/1/2021 a new observation could be 2.1M. Users can add multiple observations.

schema_fields.title: Measured Property
schema_fields.description: Initially this will be defaulted to "COUNT"
